links.*: The Collected Poems of J.R.R. Tolkien

wikitext.*:
'''Long-worms''' were either a type of [[dragon]] in [[Middle-earth]]<ref name=EoA>{{webcite|author=Mark Fisher|articleurl=https://www.glyphweb.com/arda/l/longworms.html|articlename=Long-worms|dated=7 August 1999|website=EoA|accessed=}}</ref> or another name that [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] used for at least some of them.<ref name="appendix">{{App|Eorl}}</ref>

The only long-worm mentioned by name was [[Scatha]], the great dragon of [[Ered Mithrin]]. He<ref name=collectedpoems>{{CP|177}}</ref> was slain by [[Fram]] of the [[Éothéod]] in the [[Third Age]]. For a long time afterwards, the long-worms did not pose any threat to the land.<ref name="appendix"/>

It is possible that the term referred to wingless dragons since Scatha was a wingless [[cold-drakes|cold-drake]].<ref name=collectedpoems/> It is unknown whether Scatha was the last of the long-worms or if some still existed.

Tolkien regularly used "[[worms|worm]]" as a nickname for dragons - examples include [[Glaurung]],<ref>{{CH|16}}</ref> Scatha,<ref name="appendix"/> and [[Smaug]]<ref>{{H|1}}</ref> - but it is uncertain whether this refers to the long-worms as well.
